Short-term Insurance.title: Breaking News With Short-Term - Hartman Insurance Services
Short-term Insurance.snippet: What You Need to Know About Short-Term Health Insurance Rule Updates. On August 7, 2025, the U.S. Departments of Labor, Health and Human Services (HHS), and the Treasury released a statement regarding short-term, limited-duration health insurance plans. These policies are designed to give individuals flexible, temporary coverage and can be a helpful option when you need major medical insurance outside of traditional enrollment periods.

Short-term Insurance.title: Federal Agencies Announce Shift in Short-Term Health Insurance Enforcement
Short-term Insurance.snippet: On August 7, 2025, the U.S. Departments of Labor, Health and Human Services (HHS), and the Treasury announced they are reconsidering the regulatory definition of short-term, limited-duration insurance (STLDI) through a formal notice-and-comment rulemaking process.

Short-term Insurance.title: Federal agencies signal a shift in enforcement of short-term health insurance rules | AHA News - American Hospital Association
Short-term Insurance.snippet: The U.S. Departments of Labor, Health and Human Services, and the Treasury announced Aug. 7 that they are reconsidering the definition of short-term, limited-duration insurance through a formal rulemaking process.

Insurance Brokers.title: Broker News & Industry Insights
Insurance Brokers.snippet: Recent news includes Everest's financial strength affirmation, Aviva hiring BMS's Eyre, and various other updates on broker moves, M&A activity, and market trends within the insurance industry.

Insurance Brokers.title: High Five: Catch up on the biggest stories this week
Insurance Brokers.snippet: This week's top stories include JMG Group's acquisition spree, Liberty Specialty Markets' organizational changes, and leadership changes at Hedron Network and McGill and Partners.

Insurance Brokers.title: Agencies news, trends and insights
Insurance Brokers.snippet: Recent news includes Arthur J. Gallagher & Co.'s acquisition of Bremer Insurance Agencies, Lincoln International's agreement to buy MarshBerry, and updates on insurance agent fraud schemes.

Underwriting.title: Best's Special Report: U.S. Property/Casualty Industry Records $11.2 Billion in Underwriting Income in First-Half 2025
Underwriting.snippet: The U.S. property/casualty (P/C) industry recorded $11.2 billion in net underwriting income in the first half of 2025, a significant improvement from the $2.9 billion posted in the same prior-year period, according to a new AM Best report.

Underwriting.title: The value of underwriting will increase, says Swiss Re's Haegeli & Lot
Underwriting.snippet: Jérôme Haegeli, Group Chief Economist & Head Swiss Re Institute, emphasised that the value of underwriting is increasing, with the role of an underwriter evolving dramatically, powered by Artificial Intelligence (AI).

Underwriting.title: New age of underwriting
Underwriting.snippet: As the insurance industry rapidly evolves, the integration of AI and data analytics is reshaping the underwriting landscape.  The rise of data-powered underwriting offers significant opportunities to streamline routine tasks, enhance accuracy, and allow underwriters to focus on more complex cases.

Claims Management.title: Claims news, trends and insights
Claims Management.snippet: Texas Cabinet Supplier to Pay $12M Settlement Over False Claims Act Violations.  Massachusetts Settles Asbestos Claims With Abatement Firm, Supermarket. Farmers Adjusters Cry Foul Over Workloads, Claims Handling in Letter to Regulators. Report: Ransomware Attackers 'More Systematic,' Claims Become Costlier. Bankruptcy Judge Rules Church Insurers Lack Standing to Contest Abuse Claims.

Claims Management.title: Premium hikes driven by claims costs, but insurers told to improve claims handling
Claims Management.snippet: FCA analysis shows that increases in the cost of motor claims have contributed to premium increases.  Referral fees from credit hire firms and claims management companies were associated with slower claims processing and increasing costs. Poor claims handling practices included lack of oversight of outsourced services, insufficient management information, high rejection rates for storm damage claims, and inappropriate use of cash settlements.

Claims Management.title: FCA taking action against firms after finding evidence of 'poor' handling of insurance claims
Claims Management.snippet: The FCA is taking action against firms exhibiting poor claims handling practices. Rising motor insurance premiums are largely driven by external cost pressures, but shortcomings persist in how some insurers handle claims. Poor practices include lack of oversight of outsourced services, resulting in poor customer outcomes, delays in settling claims, and high complaint volumes.

Insurance News.title: Health agent associations are speaking out against a new federal policy
Insurance News.snippet: Health agent associations are speaking out against a new federal policy that they say is hindering agents from enrolling people in coverage on the federal health insurance marketplace.

Insurance News.title: HHS appeals ruling that stalls major Obamacare marketplace changes
Insurance News.snippet: The Trump administration is appealing a ruling last month that blocked several parts of an Affordable Care Act exchange enrollment and eligibility rule.

Insurance News.title: Texas Insurer New Century Placed in Receivership and Liquidation
Insurance News.snippet: Texas Insurer New Century Placed in Receivership and Liquidation

1st for Women.title: Drunk female driver in a Volkswagen hit a servicewoman in Kyiv and fled the scene of the accident
1st for Women.snippet: In Kyiv, a drunk female driver in a Volkswagen hit a 23-year-old servicewoman at a pedestrian crossing, ignoring a red traffic light. The victim was hospitalized, and the driver was detained; criminal proceedings have been initiated.

1st for Women.title: Government considering compensation for victims of carer's allowance scandal
1st for Women.snippet: Ministers have vowed to fix benefit after Guardian revealed thousands had been plunged into debt for accidentally breaking rules.

1st for Women.title: Women's Rights in Review 30 Years After Beijing
1st for Women.snippet: A summary of achievements and challenges in women's rights 30 years after the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action, highlighting progress in legislation and persistent inequalities.

4 Sure Insurance.title: Sure launches insurance industry's first Model Context Protocol (MCP) capability, enabling AI agents to quote, bind, and service policies.
4 Sure Insurance.snippet: Sure has launched a new capability that allows AI agents to quote, bind, and service insurance policies.

4 Sure Insurance.title: Sure launches Sure Verify™ to transform insurance coverage verification for property management industry.
4 Sure Insurance.snippet: Sure has released Sure Verify™, a new tool designed to streamline insurance coverage verification for the property management sector.

4 Sure Insurance.title: New research from Sure reveals striking digital divide of insurance preferences between younger and older consumers.
4 Sure Insurance.snippet: Recent research by Sure highlights significant differences in insurance preferences between younger and older generations.

Absa Insurance.title: Absa foresees higher earnings as credit losses ease
Absa Insurance.snippet: Absa expects strong earnings growth from its restructured personal and private banking division, supported by lower credit impairments, though revenue growth remains subdued.  The credit loss ratio is projected to be at the top end of its through-the-cycle target range of 75 to 100 basis points.

Absa Insurance.title: Absa Group Delivered 17% Headline Earnings Growth Driven by Lower Impairments and Pre-Provision Profit Growth
Absa Insurance.snippet: Absa Group delivered strong earnings growth for the first half of 2025, reflecting successful execution of its strategic priorities. Headline earnings increased 17% as credit impairments declined and pre-provision profit grew. Revenue increased, underpinned by strong non-interest income growth and stable net interest income.

Absa Insurance.title: Absa Group CEO remarks on the Group's 2025 interim results performance
Absa Insurance.snippet: Absa Group CEO, Kenny Fihla, discusses the key highlights of the Group's strong 2025 interim results performance, emphasizing 17% earnings growth and a reduced credit loss ratio.  He highlights the contributions of employees and the company's customer-centric approach.

Aegis Insurance.title: Aegis General faces lawsuit as rivals allege executive poaching, trade secrets theft
Aegis Insurance.snippet: Aegis General Insurance is facing a lawsuit from Millennial Specialty Insurance and The Baldwin Group Colleague, who claim their rival poached four top executives and key trade secrets to launch a lookalike insurance program.  The lawsuit alleges that Aegis used Millennial's confidential information to quickly establish its new program, including using some of the same reinsurance brokers and syndicate panels.

Aegis Insurance.title: Insurance News • Aegis Insurance Services, Inc.
Aegis Insurance.snippet: Articles on various insurance topics including work zone safety for commercial drivers, umbrella insurance for military moving and storage providers, and the importance of clean driving records for fleet savings.

Aegis Insurance.title: News Archives - Aegis Insurance
Aegis Insurance.snippet: Announcements regarding new California Dwelling Fire and Residential Earthquake insurance products offered by Aegis General Insurance Agency, backed by DB Insurance Company and Palomar Specialty Insurance Company respectively.  Information on IVANS downloads for new carrier partners is also included.

African General Insurance.title: Morocco ranks second in African insurance market with $5.5 bln in premiums
African General Insurance.snippet: Morocco secured the second-largest share of Africa's insurance market in 2023, accounting for 8.7% of premiums collected on the continent, or about $5.54 billion (55.8 billion dirhams).

African General Insurance.title: Nigeria: Heirs Insurance Group Rated 'A', 'A1' By Augusto &co
African General Insurance.snippet: Rating agency Agusto & Co, has assigned strong ratings to both Heirs Life Assurance and Heirs General Insurance. Heirs Life Assurance (HLA) was upgraded from "A-" to "A" (long-term), with a short-term rating of "A1". Heirs General Insurance (HGI) was rated "A-"(long-term) and "A1" (short-term).

African General Insurance.title: News Archives - African Insurance Organization
African General Insurance.snippet: Yared Molla, CEO of Nyala Insurance S.C. Ethiopia takes over the leadership of the AIO as President.

African Reinsurance Company.title: Africa Re gross premium rises 15% half year on portfolio expansion, disciplined underwriting
African Reinsurance Company.snippet: African Reinsurance Corporation (Africa Re) has reported strong financial results for the first half of 2025, seeing gross premium up 15.31 percent on portfolio expansion, disciplined underwriting and strong investment returns.

African Reinsurance Company.title: Africa Re launches Index-Based Livestock Insurance product in Nigeria
African Reinsurance Company.snippet: Africa Re, in collaboration with the Livestock Productivity and Resilience Support Project (L-PRES), a consortium of insurance providers, and development partners, has launched an Index-Based Livestock Insurance (IBLI) product in Nigeria.

African Reinsurance Company.title: Africa Re profit rises 32% to $22.5m
African Reinsurance Company.snippet: The African Reinsurance Corporation has reported an overall net profit of $22.5m for the first quarter of 2025, indicating a 32.5 per cent increase compared to the $16.9m profit in the same period in 2024.

AIG.title: AIG Reports Excellent Second Quarter 2025 Results
AIG.snippet: AIG announced strong second-quarter 2025 results, exceeding expectations with significant improvements in profitability and investment income.

AIG.title: AIG Appoints Scott Hallworth as Chief Digital Officer
AIG.snippet: AIG appointed Scott Hallworth as its new Chief Digital Officer, highlighting the company's commitment to digital transformation and innovation.

AIG.title: AIG reports dramatic reversal in second-quarter results
AIG.snippet: American International Group reported a significant turnaround in its second-quarter 2025 results, achieving a substantial net profit after a loss in the same period last year.

AIM Insurance.title: US giant buys adjuster Aim
AIM Insurance.snippet: American insurance investigations company Allied Universal has acquired Adelaide loss adjuster Aim Insurance Services.  The acquisition provides Aim with access to expanded resources and expertise.

AIM Insurance.title: Allied Universal acquires Aim Insurance Services
AIM Insurance.snippet: Allied Universal has completed its acquisition of Aim Insurance Services, a premier provider of property loss adjusting services in Australia.  The acquisition expands Allied Universal's insurance claims services globally.

AIM Insurance.title: Bishop Street enters personal aviation insurance market with AIM's acquisition
AIM Insurance.snippet: Bishop Street Underwriters acquired Aerospace Insurance Managers (AIM), a general aviation insurance services provider, marking Bishop Street's entry into the aviation insurance market.

Allianz.title: 'Sandwich Generation' Neglecting Retirement Savings, Allianz Life Study Finds
Allianz.snippet: Millennials and Gen Xers struggling with financial effect of caring for both children and parents.

Allianz.title: These are the winners of the Allianz Unity Awards
Allianz.snippet: Allianz Unity Awards honor sports champions in Egypt, Spain, UK for uniting communities. Winners get resources to expand efforts and boost community impact.

Allianz.title: He Didn't Want Help. They Showed Up Anyway.
Allianz.snippet: Discover how the Patient Companion Team at Allianz Private Health Insurance stood by a family in their time of greatest need.

Hollard Insurance.title: Hollard announces Andrew Coutts as CEO for Hollard Insure
Hollard Insurance.snippet: The Hollard Insurance Company Ltd is pleased to announce the appointment of Andrew Coutts as the Chief Executive Officer of Hollard Insure, the short-term insurance division of South Africa's largest privately owned insurer.

Hollard Insurance.title: Hollard concludes acquisition of Absa's Life insurance businesses in Mozambique and Botswana
Hollard Insurance.snippet: Hollard concludes acquisition of Absa's Life insurance businesses in Mozambique and Botswana.

Hollard Insurance.title: Lombard Policies Transition to Hollard
Hollard Insurance.snippet: Lombard Broker Partners policies underwritten by Lombard Insurance will be moving to Hollard Insurance.  Policyholders' benefits will remain secure and unchanged.

Santam.title: Santam names Rob Vetch as CEO & CFO of Syndicate 1918
Santam.snippet: South African general insurer Santam has appointed Rob Vetch as Chief Executive Officer (CEO) and Chief Financial Officer (CFO) of Santam Syndicate 1918.  Vetch has three decades of global re/insurance experience.

Santam.title: Executive team appointed to lead Santam Syndicate 1918
Santam.snippet: Santam, Africa's leading general insurance group, has announced the appointment of a senior and experienced executive team to lead Santam Syndicate 1918, following in principle approval by Lloyd's in July 2025.

Santam.title: Executive team appointed to lead new African insurer syndicate
Santam.snippet: Cape Town-based Santam Insurance Group has appointed a senior executive team to lead recently launched Santam Syndicate 1918, following in principle approval by Lloyd's in July 2025. Rob Vetch has been appointed as chief executive and chief financial officer designate of the syndicate.

Discovery Insure.title: Discovery Group delivers strong annual performance as it enters a distinct new growth phase with two well defined operational composites
Discovery Insure.snippet: Discovery Insure: Sustained its positive trajectory over the year, delivering an operating profit of R739 million.

Discovery Insure.title: Discovery profit jumps 30% to record high
Discovery Insure.snippet: Discovery's annual profit rose 30% to a record, paced by a jump in its South African health-insurance businesses and its Vitality franchise that benefited from folding the global wellness programme into a single business.

Discovery Insure.title: Discovery Insure wins at Global Insurance Innovation Awards 2024
Discovery Insure.snippet: Discovery Insure walked away with Best Automobile Insurance 2024 in the product innovation category for its Vitality Drive 3.0 programme.

MiWay Insurance.title: Miway achieves one of the industry-leading overturn ratios of 6%, in latest ombud report
MiWay Insurance.snippet: Miway has recorded one of the lowest overturn ratios (also referred to as resolved ratio) across the short-term insurance industry at just 6%, according to the recently released National Financial Ombud Scheme South Africa (NFO) 2024 Annual Report.  This low ratio indicates sound upfront decisions, fairness, and reliability.

MiWay Insurance.title: Khaya Mthethwa and MiWay Reach Settlement After Years Battle with Insurance Company
MiWay Insurance.snippet: Singer Khaya Mthethwa and MiWay have reached a settlement after a long legal battle regarding an insurance claim initially declined in 2016.  Mthethwa won the court case in 2024, but the settlement was reached only recently after further delays.

MiWay Insurance.title: MiWay news articles
MiWay Insurance.snippet: This source contains multiple articles related to MiWay, including discussions on car insurance myths and market updates.  Specific article dates and titles are not consistently provided.

Financial Sector Conduct Authority (FSCA.title: FSCA urges whole-of-market push to combat soaring digital fraud
Financial Sector Conduct Authority (FSCA.snippet: The FSCA is working to strengthen a coordinated approach to scams and fraud, collaborating with banks and other stakeholders to identify risks and close vulnerabilities.  Digital fraud losses reached R2.72 billion in 2024, with banking app fraud being the largest contributor.

Financial Sector Conduct Authority (FSCA.title: Financial Sector Conduct Authority Commissioner on enhancing S.Africa's market integrity
Financial Sector Conduct Authority (FSCA.snippet: FSCA Commissioner Unathi Kamlana discussed the challenges facing South Africa's financial markets, including technological advancements and global economic uncertainties.  He emphasized the need for adaptable regulations to maintain market integrity and trust.

Financial Sector Conduct Authority (FSCA.title: FSCA concerned over delayed debarments by FSPs
Financial Sector Conduct Authority (FSCA.snippet: The FSCA is concerned about delays in debarments by Financial Services Providers (FSPs), which poses a risk to the public.  The report shows a significant increase in FSP-led debarments, but the FSCA is addressing concerns about the timeliness and consistency of these actions.

Insurance Regulatory Authority.title: 2025 Insurance Regulatory Outlook
Insurance Regulatory Authority.snippet: The year 2025 will likely be pivotal for the insurance sector, with persistent challenges and others on the horizon. Insurers will need to adeptly manage heightened risks while maintaining compliance with evolving and in some cases strengthened regulatory demands.

Insurance Regulatory Authority.title: More than 1/3 of adults delaying retirement
Insurance Regulatory Authority.snippet: New York Life's latest Wealth Watch survey reveals a growing "financial confidence gap" — the difference between where Americans feel they are financially and where they aspire to be.  More than 1 in 3 adults (35%) report having delayed or intending to delay their retirement, citing insufficient savings (51%), inflation (46%), and the changing economic environment (32%) as primary reasons.

Insurance Regulatory Authority.title: Financial regulation: Latest News and Updates
Insurance Regulatory Authority.snippet: Key developments in regulation of financial markets with a focus on those in Hong Kong and mainland China.

Prudential Authority.title: PRA Regulatory Digest - June 2025
Prudential Authority.snippet: Highlights key regulatory news and publications from the Prudential Regulation Authority for June 2025, including the annual report, competitiveness report, and updates on various policy statements and consultation papers.

Prudential Authority.title: Prudential Authority Annual Report 2024/25
Prudential Authority.snippet: The annual report of the South African Prudential Authority covering the 2024/25 financial year, detailing regulatory activities, key initiatives, and progress on Basel III reforms.

Prudential Authority.title: Prudential Authority Annual Report 2024/2025
Prudential Authority.snippet: The South African Reserve Bank's Prudential Authority publishes its annual report for 2024/2025, providing an overview of its activities and performance during the year.

Short-term Insurance Act.title: Federal Agencies Announce Shift in Short-Term Health Insurance Enforcement
Short-term Insurance Act.snippet: On August 7, 2025, the U.S. Departments of Labor, Health and Human Services (HHS), and the Treasury announced they are reconsidering the regulatory definition of short-term, limited-duration insurance (STLDI) through a formal notice-and-comment rulemaking process.  Until any new rules are finalized, the agencies will not prioritize enforcement actions for violations related to failing to meet the 2024 definition of STLDI.

Short-term Insurance Act.title: Federal agencies signal a shift in enforcement of short-term health insurance rules
Short-term Insurance Act.snippet: The U.S. Departments of Labor, Health and Human Services, and the Treasury announced Aug. 7 that they are reconsidering the definition of short-term, limited-duration insurance through a formal rulemaking process. Until new rules are finalized, the departments will not prioritize enforcement actions against insurers that do not fully comply with the 2024 definition.

Short-term Insurance Act.title: Agencies Suspend Limited Duration Health Insurance Rules
Short-term Insurance Act.snippet: In a Statement issued August 7, 2025, the Departments of Labor, Health and Human Services (“HHS”), and the Treasury announced they will not enforce the current regulations for short-term, limited-duration health insurance contracts.  Until future rulemaking is issued, the Departments do not intend to prioritize enforcement actions for violations related to failing to meet the definition of short-term, limited duration insurance in the 2024 final rules.

Regulatory Compliance.title: Government issues new modern slavery guidance on supply chain transparency
Regulatory Compliance.snippet: The United Kingdom government released updated guidelines addressing modern slavery in supply chains, emphasizing transparency.

Regulatory Compliance.title: EU Drafts Data Transfer Deal with Brazil
Regulatory Compliance.snippet: The European Commission proposed a decision recognizing Brazil's adequate personal data protection, enabling easier data transfers between the EU and Brazil.

Regulatory Compliance.title: FTC orders AI firms to disclose safeguards for children and teens
Regulatory Compliance.snippet: The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) directed seven AI companies to detail their safety measures protecting children and teenagers using their AI chatbots.
